Title: Defections, legal disputes rock PDP as APC govs project strength, unity in Kebbi
Summary: As defections and legal disputes tear through the Peoples Democratic Party, the All Progressives Congress rallies its governors in quiet cohesion in Kebbi . The contrast is pushing Nigeria’s democracy closer to the edge of one-party dominance .

Title: How praise-singers override party agenda, scorecards at rallies
Summary: With musicians playing more prominent roles in election campaigns, they lend rhythm and excitement to political rallies nationwide, turning campaign grounds into concert arenas . Praise-singers use their popularity to sway public sentiment .

Title: Heavy reliance on oil, domestic debt expose Nigeria to financial risks, IMF warns
Summary: IMF cautions Nigeria against undue reliance on domestic debt market . Heavy reliance on oil, domestic debt expose Nigeria to financial risks, IMF warns . IMF says it would increase financial stability risks .

Title: Amupitan confirmed as INEC chairman, pledges inclusivity
Summary: Prof. Joash Amupitan (SAN) is the sixth substantive occupant of the position since Nigeria’s return to democratic rule in 1999 . The Senate confirmed his appointment as Chairman of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC)

Title: Japa: Nigeria losing top professors to foreign varsities, ASUU laments
Summary: Academic Staff Union of Universities (ASUU) decries growing resignations among high-profile professors in public universities who are leaving the country in search of better opportunities abroad . ASUU laments that Nigeria is losing top professors to foreign varsities .

Title: NAF to shut Lagos airport road on Saturday for routine exercise
Summary: The exercise was part of ongoing efforts by the NAF to promote physical fitness, health, and operational readiness . The exercise, scheduled to commence at 6 a.m. and end by 8 a. m. The exercise is scheduled to start at 6 p.m., and the airport road will be shut on Saturday .

Title: Google unveils AI skills training for public servants
Summary: Google announced on Thursday in Abuja that the partnership was with the Ministry of Communications, Innovation and Digital Economy . Google announced the partnership on Thursday .

Title: Amnesty International advocates abolition of death penalty
Summary: Amnesty International advocates abolition of death penalty . Magaji stressed the need to remove all provisions in national and state laws that violate international human rights law .

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, October 17, 2025
Summary: The naira traded in the mid-₦1,400s on official Nigerian Foreign Exchange Market (NFEM) platforms on Friday .

Title: FG to launch national campaign to promote Made-in-Nigeria goods
Summary: FG to launch national campaign to promote Made-in-Nigeria goods . Campaign aims to shift national demand towards Nigerian products that meet global quality standards .
